intro: Potentilla norvegica var. genuina, commonly known as the Norwegian cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters, featuring wiry stems and dense foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers in early summer, which are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five oval-shaped leaflets, and are often covered in fine hairs. This species is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found in alpine or coastal environments.
